messages.subject: Re: Other names for "unschooling"

messages.messageBody:
On 14, Jun 2008, at 12:13 PM, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> 1a. Re: other names for "unschooling"
> From: :: anne | arun ::

BE:
It seems that in the UK "personal learning" is equivalent to
"unschooling."
It also fits better with Ilich's "deschooling." But his was talking
about
deschooling society . His "learning freedom" or "convivial learning"
was
more a model for how life should be conducted with friends and
colleagues
with joy and without compulsion. We can't life free unless we are free
to learn.

Bill Elllis
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/AGaianParadigm/files/
